question:
You are going on a short training course at a college in New Zealand. You need somewhere to live while you are there.
Write a letter to the accommodation officer at the college. In your letter,
explain your situation
describe the accommodation you require
say when you will need it
text: I am writing this letter to inquire about the accommodation facilities available for the course seekers at your college.
I am Alex Jones, an applicant for the forthcoming training course on "Mass Communication", at your college. I am hoping that you would kindly arrange suitable accommodation for me.

I am currently employed in Southern Ireland, as a Trainer in a multinational accounting firm. As you already know, the course which I have joined will start from 1st of July. In Ireland, a location far away from the city where I live.

I would like to take the privilege of describing my accommodation needs. First of all, I am expecting a small flat or at least a room for me. Secondly, I would like to dwell in calm and quiet environment, as the peace of the workplace is important to me. Lastly, I would be glad to stay close to the course venue, so as to save time and concentrate on studies.

I plan to arrive on 27th of this month and hence would request you to finalize my flat or room before I arrive. I will stay at this place as long as I have my training course, possibly till September.
